book.name: Activity 1: Finding Employability Skills in a Lesson
book.intro: Activity 1: Finding Employability Skills in a Lesson

chapter.title: Utilizing Workforce Preparation Activities & Employability Skills checklist
chapter.content:
To illustrate how workforce preparation activities and employability skills can be embedded in lessons whose content is not explicitly related to employment, workplace context, etc., we’ll review selected resources for identifying Employability Skills, available on OCTAE’s Employability Skills Framework Website and The College and Career Readiness Success Center.

One resource you will practice using is a Lesson Planning Checklist that lists employability skills that are often incorporated in routine classroom activities.  Note that the checklist includes sample classroom activities for learning and practicing each skill and sub-skill. For additional examples, refer to course #1 for descriptions and information about the Transitions Integration Framework and Guide to ELA Classroom Activities that Promote Life Skills, College, and Career Readiness.

chapter.title: Step 1: Review the lesson
chapter.content: Open and review the General Education Lesson: Create a Brochure for a Fitness Program developed by the College and Career Readiness Success Center at the Center for Great Teachers and Leaders. The lesson is for secondary education students, but is applicable for our purposes. Notice that the lesson does not explicitly address a specific occupation or workplace scenario.

chapter.title: Step 2: Compare lesson with Employability Skills Lesson Planning Checklist
chapter.content:
• Open the Employability Skills Framework: Lesson Planning Checklist online. If you would like to print the checklist instead of using it online, click “Printer-Friendly” in the upper, right side corner and print from your computer. 
  • Read over the checklist, noting the components of a lesson that provide instruction and practice for each skill. To view the descriptions online, hover your mouse over each skill and the descriptions will pop up. 
  • Now compare the Create a Brochure for a Fitness Program lesson with the Skills Checklist. Note instances where students are learning and practicing specific employability skills. Mark the skills on your checklist.

chapter.title: Step 3: Check your answers
chapter.content:
Compare the skills that you identified against the list of skills taught through the lesson:

  • Applied Academic Skills
    • Uses reading skills
    • Uses writing skills
  • Critical Thinking
    • Thinks creatively
    • Makes sound decisions
    • Solves problems
    • Reasons
    • Plans and organizes
  • Interpersonal Skills
    • Understands teamwork and works with others
    • Responds to customer needs
    • Exercises leadership
    • Negotiates to resolve conflict
    • Respects individual differences
  • Personal Qualities
    • Demonstrates responsibility and self-discipline
    • Works independently
    • Takes initiative
  • Resource Management
    • Manages time
  • Information Use
    • Locates
    • Organizes
    • Uses
    • Analyzes
    • Communicates
  • Systems Thinking
    • Understands and uses systems
    • Monitors systems
    • Improves systems
  • Communication Skills
    • Conveys information in writing
    • Observes carefully
  • Technology Use
    • Uses and understands technology

 

Now that you have completed the first three steps, continue to Step 4: Draft an objective for Employability Skills.
